meanings.definition: Showing disapproval or contempt towards others, especially those considered inferior.
meanings.sent1: The snootier lady turned up her nose at the simple decorations.
meanings.sent2: She always acts snootier than everyone else at the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a snootier look to the dog, making the dog feel small.
meanings.sent4: Her snootier attitude was like a dark cloud overshadowing the cheerful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The snootier expression on his face made it clear he was not impressed.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a haughty or arrogant manner.
meanings.sent1: He felt snootier than the other students after winning the competition.
meanings.sent2: The snootier man refused to acknowledge anyone he deemed unworthy.
meanings.sent3: The snootier behavior of the boss made the employees roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her snootier tone echoed through the room, silencing the chatter.
meanings.sent5: The snootier stance he took only pushed people further away.

meanings.definition: Having an attitude of superiority or condescension.
meanings.sent1: The snootier professor always made students feel inadequate.
meanings.sent2: She became even snootier after receiving the prestigious award.
meanings.sent3: His snootier remarks were met with awkward silence from the group.
meanings.sent4: The snootier aura around her made others feel small in comparison.
meanings.sent5: The snootier way she spoke made it clear she thought highly of herself.
